oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Jama Coaque female figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jama Coaque
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian solid figure with large adorned headdress and ear adornments. Clove shaped breasts just above an exagerated navel. Possibly a fertility figure. Adornment on the chin starting at the lip and going down. Left arm is slightly longer than the right arm. Large rounded protrusion that flattens and runs down the back side of the figurine.

Breakage below the exagerated navel suggests this figure might have been representative of a full body at one point. Both arms have been broken off and reglued. some chipping around the edges but overall the features are clear and the piece is in good condition.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
